intro: Chrysanthemum intermedium, commonly known as the Japanese chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers well-drained soil and full sun. It is often cultivated for ornamental purposes in gardens and is also used in traditional medicine. Its blooming period usually occurs in the fall, adding vibrant color to the landscape during that season.
